title: Enikő Berkes
text:
Enikő Berkes (born 3 October 1975) is a Hungarian former competitive <a href="ice%20dancer">ice dancer</a>. With <a href="Szil%C3%A1rd%20T%C3%B3th">Szilárd Tóth</a>, she is the 1993 <a href="Golden%20Spin%20of%20Zagreb">Golden Spin of Zagreb</a> bronze medalist and 1994 <a href="Hungarian%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">national</a> champion. They represented Hungary at the <a href="Figure%20skating%20at%20the%201994%20Winter%20Olympics">1994 Winter Olympics</a>.
Career.
Partnership with Tóth.
Berkes began her partnership with <a href="Szil%C3%A1rd%20T%C3%B3th">Szilárd Tóth</a> by 1991. They competed in the final segment at four <a href="ISU%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">ISU Championships</a>, placing 15th at the <a href="1992%20World%20Junior%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1992 World Junior Championships</a> in <a href="Hull%2C%20Quebec">Hull, Quebec</a>, Canada; 20th at the <a href="1993%20European%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1993 European Championships</a> in <a href="Helsinki">Helsinki</a>, Finland; 24th at the <a href="1994%20European%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1994 European Championships</a> in <a href="Copenhagen">Copenhagen</a>, Denmark; and 23rd at the <a href="1995%20European%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1995 European Championships</a> in <a href="Dortmund">Dortmund</a>, Germany.
Berkes/Tóth were named in Hungary's team to the <a href="Figure%20skating%20at%20the%201994%20Winter%20Olympics">1994 Winter Olympics</a> in <a href="Hamar">Hamar</a>. They finished 20th in Norway.
Partnership with Szentirmai.
In 1995, Berkes teamed up with <a href="Endre%20Szentirmai">Endre Szentirmai</a>. They were coached by <a href="Krisztina%20Reg%C5%91czy">Krisztina Regőczy</a> in Budapest. After winning the national title, they placed 18th at the <a href="1996%20European%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1996 European Championships</a> in <a href="Sofia">Sofia</a>, Bulgaria. At the <a href="1996%20World%20Figure%20Skating%20Championships">1996 World Championships</a>, held in <a href="Edmonton">Edmonton</a>, Alberta, Canada, they qualified to the free dance and finished 24th overall.
Post-competitive career.
Berkes is an <a href="ISU%20Judging%20System">ISU technical specialist</a> for Hungary in the ice dancing category. She served as the assistant technical specialist at the <a href="2008%20Four%20Continents%20Championships">2008 Four Continents Championships</a>; as the technical specialist at the <a href="2007%20NHK%20Trophy">2007 NHK Trophy</a> as the assistant technical specialist during the <a href="2006%20Troph%C3%A9e%20Eric%20Bompard">2006 Trophée Eric Bompard</a>, and for many <a href="ISU%20Junior%20Grand%20Prix">ISU Junior Grand Prix</a> events.
Results.
"GP: <a href="ISU%20Grand%20Prix%20of%20Figure%20Skating">Champions Series (Grand Prix)</a>"
